column1: Fladderak is a contract packer located it the port of Rotterdam. There storage facility comprises 15.000 m2. Main activities are in the offshore and petrochemical industry. They are the second largest contract packers of the Netherlands, preceded by Meilink and  followed by Van Doorn.

The packaging specs are most of the time decided by their client and, therefore, binding.  They pack almost all protective specs with alufoil and desiccant. Up to now, they have had only a couple of packaging requests with VCI. The VCI, they get from Nefab and is from Cortec.
They are not very familiar with VCI yet and clearly lack experience. Nobody has given them any training and instructions.
In case there is no binding spec. they can propose the type of packaging: wood, cardboard, alu, etc.
What do they expect from suppliers?:
-       short delivery times
-       packaging advice
-       wide range of products on stock
How to go forward form here:
-       select a packaging product, where VCI  and alu are compared
-       make a presentation on material cost difference
-       estimate labor cost – 30%
-       send prices V450 film in 4 and 6 m
-       pack method for  electrical cabinets

column1: The company belongs to the Gietburg group.  The majority of the production goes to the machining company within the group, Doesburg Components. They also use other machine shops in the Netherlands and Germany.

The company has been investing again, something that was not done since a long time. They are working in 2 shifts and a 3rd shift is imminent, if demand keeps rising. The investments were mostly done in the finishing area, where they employ more and more robots to deburr the parts.

Main clients are: DAF and Scania (Sweden, France, Netherlands and Brazil). They are also trying to get contract from MAN.  In the case of Scania, they receive crates and boxes. Only a small part travels oversea.
The corrosion incidents are negligible since they work with VCI. They used to order only from Branopac, but placed an order with us most recently. They are quite satisfied with the quality.
Durning the factory inspection, I saw that the bags were not well closed. Furthermore, no buffering material was used between the crates and the VCI bag.
I suggested that an audit and training would be advisable in the medium term.
